Kali Linux.details: Kali Linux is a specialized Linux distribution designed for penetration testing, digital forensics, and security auditing. It is based on Debian and includes a vast array of pre-installed tools used by security professionals and enthusiasts for various cybersecurity tasks.

Arch Linux.details: Arch Linux is a lightweight and highly customizable operating system that focuses on simplicity, user control, and cutting-edge software. It's designed for users who want to build their system from the ground up, selecting and configuring only the components they need.

Fedora.details: Fedora is a user-friendly and cutting-edge Linux distribution sponsored by Red Hat. It aims to provide a balance between stability and innovation, making it suitable for both desktop and server use.

Debian.details: Debian is one of the oldest and most respected Linux distributions, known for its stability, security, and commitment to free software principles. It provides a robust and reliable operating system suitable for servers, desktops, and embedded devices.

Alpine Linux.details: Alpine Linux is a lightweight and security-focused Linux distribution designed primarily for containers, embedded devices, and server environments.

openSUSE.details: openSUSE is a user-friendly and versatile Linux distribution known for its stability, ease of use, and powerful system management tools. It offers two main editions: Leap and Tumbleweed. Leap follows a regular release cycle with stable versions, while Tumbleweed is a rolling release with the latest software updates.

Gentoo.details: Gentoo is a highly customizable and performance-oriented Linux distribution known for its source-based package management system.

NixOS.details: NixOS is a unique and innovative Linux distribution known for its declarative approach to system configuration and package management.

Manjaro.details: Manjaro is a user-friendly and accessible Linux distribution based on Arch Linux. It aims to provide a stable, easy-to-use system while retaining the flexibility and customization options of Arch.

EndeavourOS.details: EndeavourOS is a user-friendly Arch Linux-based distribution that aims to provide a streamlined and straightforward experience for users interested in Arch without the initial complexities.

Linux Mint.details: Linux Mint is a popular and user-friendly Linux distribution based on Ubuntu and Debian. It aims to provide a reliable, elegant, and easy-to-use operating system for desktop users.

Artix Linux.details: Artix Linux is a rolling-release Linux distribution that is based on Arch Linux but differs in its approach to init systems.
